head.title: Impac Dublin Literary Award Finalists Announced

hedline.hl1: Impac Dublin Literary Award Finalists Announced
hedline.hl2: Impac Dublin Literary Award Finalists Announced

block.p: Salman Rushdie of Britain, Cormac McCarthy and Jonathan Safran Foer of the United States and J. M. Coetzee of South Africa made it to the shortlist of eight contenders yesterday for the $135,500 International Impac Dublin Literary Award, billed as the world's richest prize for a single work of fiction, Reuters reported. Other finalists are Per Petterson of Norway, Peter Hobbs and Julian Barnes of Britain and Sebastian Barry of Ireland. The winner will be announced in Dublin on June 14.
